Configuration.StudyNameEntrez: Genetic Study on Nephropathy in Type-2 Diabetes
Configuration.StudyNameReportPage: Genetic Study on Nephropathy in Type-2 Diabetes
Configuration.Description: A collection of patients with type-2 diabetes was collected at the Joslin Diabetes Center. Patients were categorized to a group of cases with diabetic nephropathy, and a group of controls with normoalbuminuria. From these groups, 173 cases and 177 controls were randomly selected for a genome-wide association study.
Configuration.StudyInEx:
Inclusion as Participant:

  1. Self-reported diabetes mellitus (DM)
  2. Age at diagnosis of DM greater than 40, or age at diagnosis between 20 and 40 and no insulin treatment, or age at diagnosis between 20 and 40 and initiation of insulin treatment more than 2 years after diagnosis of DM
  3. Absence of non-diabetic kidney disease

Inclusion as Control:

  1. Normoalbuminuria
  2. CKD Stage 1 or 2
  3. Duration of DM of at least 3 years
  4. Hemoglobin A1c of at least 6

Inclusion as Case:

  1. Proteinuria or End-Stage Renal Disease or Microalbuminuria and CKD Stage 4 or 5

Journal.authors: Pezzolesi MG, Poznik GD, Mychaleckyj JC, Dunn JS, Rich SS, Warram JH, Krolewski AS
Journal.title: Genome-wide Association Scans in Type 1 and Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Provide Evidence of a Shared Etiology: Identification of a Common Diabetic Nephropathy Locus on Chromosome 15q
